{{location infobox | name=Brandywine Bridge | image=Miriam Ellis - Marcho and Blanco cross the Brandywine.jpg | caption="[[Marcho and Blanco]] cross [[Baranduin|the Brandywine]]" by [[Miriam Ellis]] | pronun= | othernames=Bridge of Stonebows
Great Bridge
''i Varanduiniant''{{SD|XI}}, pp. 117, 128-9 | location=[[The Shire]], where the [[East Road]] crosses the [[Baranduin]] | type=Bridge | description=Stone bridge | regions= | towns= | inhabitants= | created= | destroyed= | events= | gallery=the Brandywine Bridge }} The '''Brandywine Bridge''', also known as the '''Bridge of Baranduin''', was the bridge on the [[East Road]] crossing the River [[Baranduin]]; it marked the eastern border of [[the Shire]].{{FR|Part}} The Hobbits measured distances from the east-end of the Brandywine Bridge.{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Bridge of Stonebows'', p. 20 ==History== Originally called the '''Bridge of Stonebows''', it was built during the days of power of [[Arnor]]. [[Marcho]] and [[Blanco]] with their [[Hobbit]] followers passed that bridge to settle in [[the Shire]]. The [[Kings of Arnor]] required them to keep the Great Bridge in repair (as well as all other bridges and roads).{{FR|Hobbits}} [[Frodo Baggins]] and his companions did not use the bridge when they left the Shire in {{TA|3018|n}}. However, on their return trip they came to the bridge on [[30 October]] {{TA|3019|n}}.{{App|Chief}} To their surprise they found the bridge blocked on both ends with two spiked gates. Despite a sign proclaiming "No admittance between sundown and sunrise" the four hobbits made their way over the bridge, after dispatching [[Bill Ferny]]. They stayed the night at the guard-house before moving on to rouse the Shire.{{RK|VI8}} In {{FoA|15}} King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] rode to the Brandywine Bridge and greeted his old friends (but did not cross into the Shire for he himself had forbidden men to enter the land in an edict of {{FoA|6}}). At this meeting he bestowed the [[Star of the Dúnedain]] on [[Samwise Gamgee]] and made Sam's daughter [[Elanor Gardner|Elanor]] a maid of honour to Queen [[Arwen]].{{App|Later}} ==Etymology== "Stonebow" is from Old English ''stánbogan'', meaning a stone arch. The only quotations for the word, in the Oxford English Dictionary and the online Bosworth Toller Dictionary of Old English, are from ''Beowulf'', where it appears twice, at lines 2545 and 2718, describing the lair of the dragon who kills the hero. In [[Sindarin]], the name of the bridge was '''''i Varanduiniant'''''. ''[[i]]'' is the singular definite article "the", which causes the initial ''b-'' in ''[[Baranduin#Etymology|Baranduin]]'' to take the [[Lenition|lenited]] form ''v-'' (i.e., ''Varanduin''); the final element ''[[iant]]'' means "bridge".{{VT|50a}}, p. 12 ==Other versions of the legendarium== The [[Bucklebury Ferry]] was said to be ''twenty'' miles south of the Bridge by [[Merry]]{{FR|Conspiracy}} but this was corrected to ''ten'' in the [[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)|50th Anniversary Edition]].{{HM|FR}}, Note on the 50th Anniversary Edition, p.xvii ==Portrayal in adaptations== ===The Brandywine Bridge in adaptations=== File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Brandywine Bridge.jpg|''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' File:Aragorn's Quest - Brandywine Bridge.png|''[[The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest]]'' '''[[2007]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :The Brandywine Bridge is a landmark in the Bridgefields. Talking to a character near the bridge starts the quest "The Tale of the Shipwrecked Mariners".{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://lotro-wiki.com/index.php/Brandywine_Bridge|articlename=Brandywine Bridge|dated=8 August 2012|website=[http://lotro-wiki.com/index.php/Main_Page LOTRO-wiki.com]|accessed=15 March 2013}} '''[[2010]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest]]'':''' :The meeting of Elessar and the Mayor in {{FoA|15}} is featured in a cutscene after the last mission. It is portrayed as a low, wooden bridge."[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QZxeX7tYekQ Lord of the Rings Aragonr's Quest Walkthrough Black Gates pt 2 ]", [http://www.youtube.com YouTube] (accessed 30 June 2012) ==External links== *[http://middle-earth.xenite.org/2013/02/05/what-does-the-name-of-the-bridge-of-stonebows-refer-to/ What Does the Name of the Bridge of Stonebows Refer To?] by [[Michael Martinez]] {{References}} [[Category:Bridges]] [[Category:The Shire]] [[de:Brandyweinbrücke]] [[fi:Rankkivuon Silta]]
